isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 2000 4000 and 8000 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - ALLISON 2000 SERIES™ (LCT) TRANSMISSION ELECTRONIC CONTROLS - ALLISON 2000 SERIES TRANSMISSION DIAGNOSTIC CODES

svcsubsecinfo.para: Illumination of the CHECK TRANSMISSION light during vehicle operation indicates that the TCM has registered a diagnostic code.

svcproc.title: DIAGNOSTIC TROUBLE CODES (DTCs)

note.para: DTCs can only be read by using service tool, running TransPro diagnostic software, capable of connecting to the 9-pin diagnostic connector of the vehicle.

svcproc.para: This service manual section provides a "limited" discussion of the Allison 2000 Series diagnostic trouble codes (DTCs). For a complete, in-depth discussion, refer to the Allison 2000 Series Transmission Service Manual.

Illumination of CHECK TRANSMISSION light at any time other than start-up indicates that the TCM has identified a fault in the transmission. At this time the TCM will set an active DTC. If the fault is intermittent and goes away the DTC will become inactive but will remain in history.
Depending on the fault a DTC may be set without activating the CHECK TRANSMISSION light.
All active codes are cleared during TCM power down. After 40 code free warm-up cycles, all codes will disappear from memory if they do not re-occur.

note.para: If the service tool and TransPro software are unable to communicate with the TCM on the J1939 datalink perform the steps in troubleshooting table J1939 Data Link

svcproc.para: The TransPro will display all active and historical codes in chronological order. The TCM also captures and stores a failure record for the last five DTCs (active or inactive). The information in the failure record may assist the technician in identifying the cause of the DTC. See the documentation accompanying the TransPro software for details on its setup and use.
The TransPro can be used to clear all codes in the TCM.
